website_summaries.verdict: A large, high-quality deep fryer that's great for big meals and has some nice extras.
pros: Includes an adjustable thermostat and a filtration system for used oil that filters in a storage tank
Everything but the power cord and the heating element and the control unit is dishwasher-safe
cons: The frying area could be a little deeper

website_summaries.verdict: Without question the best electric deep fryer on the market.
pros: Features like the oil drain filter, the sealed cooking lid, and the easily detachable and washable parts make the Ultimate EZ Clean Fryer a model well worthy of its price
cons: Its basket may be difficult to clean due to batter potentially sticking to the mesh wiring

customer_reviews.title: I could tell something was wrong so I verified using two independent and highly accurate thermometers and this piece of crap is
customer_reviews.text: Does not get to temperature. I could tell something was wrong so I verified using two independent and highly accurate thermometers and this piece of crap is almost 35 degrees under what it claims. Yes, the oil filter is great but inaccurate temps make this item useless.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: How does it work?  It doesn’t.
customer_reviews.text: Had really high hopes for this product. But in the end it simply did not work as advertised. You cannot fry anything breaded, because the paddle system rips all of the breading off and leaves a soggy mess. I even tried vegtables fries, which again did not crisp at all and came out limp. The cord is very short which made it hard to plug in. Finally this appliance is gargantuan and takes up too much space on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nutter

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in October 2017 and have used it regularly for chips, spag bol, curries, risotto, sausages, but, for this kind of money, I expected it to last longer than 9 months. The buttons depress but do not change the time any longer as the lid no longer seals. I guess from the heat as the lid is just plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Mirry

customer_reviews.title: I like it okay
customer_reviews.text: I like it okay. The only thing i dont like is the thing in the middle that turns. It messes up the food and sometimes its all mush. Like onion rings. They were crispy tasted good but were broken and crumbs fallen off. Sweet potatos fries or potatoes were broken or or mashed together. Salmon cakes, dont even want to go there. Donuts, i was so excited to make those in the fryer. Didnt work. I ended up making donut holes instead. Either it needs a turn table from under neath to circulate or a turn off switch or nothing at all.Pull the pan out and shake it up as recipe suggest.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: 3 years later - I may just buy another one
customer_reviews.text: We are coming up to our 3rd year with this baby, use it probably 3 times a week - it's been great. Food tastes good, love the stirring of the food means the oil and spices get mixed up well. Well after all the use it now takes about 40mins to do fries - it's leaking hot air from the seal. So I'm looking for another - haven't seen any that look better than this one so may just buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: dahitch42

customer_reviews.title: Owned for one year now
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a year now and dont hardly use it. It doesnt make crispy fries and there isnt much I really use it for. Total waste and the hype was not true. Its often much easier to cook the old fashion way and this thing does not clean up very easily. It will eventually get grease build up inside where you cannot clean. Not having a time off function is also a game changer and I would not buy something without that function again. Too dangerous! Couldn't resale for even 35.00
customer_reviews.author: Lakke2120

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy, But mmm good.
customer_reviews.text: The Actifry is simple and easy to use controls You have a push button timer and I push button on/off. The timer is removable so you can take it with you it is a very basic digital timer, we choose to leave it in the unit you could also use another timer. The unit is fairly noisy but does offer fast and convenient food within about 20 to 40 minutes. Well it may not be as fast as some fast food this is way healthier, we intend to use this for a healthy french fries and healthy stir fries as well as other recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Indiana DIY

customer_reviews.title: Great for frying most things
customer_reviews.text: After spending hours researching the right deep-fryer we went with this one and are very happy with it. You really need to read the instructions so you operate it correctly but we've used this to make french fries and calamari so far, both came out delicious. The basket is large enough that you can cook chicken in it also. The only downside is emptying the oil for future use as there is not an easy way to drain the oil from any food particle bits. We have it figured out now, but it was a learning curve. I would definitely recommend this deep-fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat Trouble
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet, but the online registration URL could not be found by any of 3 different browsers. Follow Up: I ended up having to return it because the thermostat did not work correctly. I used it 3 times to cook frozen tater tots and frozen breaded shrimp. I tested the temperature with a thermometer and could not get the temperature any higher than 352 degrees Fahrenheit. I returned a Delonghi a few weeks ago (due to oil leak) and ordered this as a replacement. I was replacing a smaller T-Fal EZ Clean that worked great for a couple of years before finally failing. I guess I'll take the hint and stop deep frying.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: The cooking times in the recipe book were ambiguous, ...
customer_reviews.text: The cooking times in the recipe book were ambiguous,so the food was either raw or charcoal briquets. All of the coatings on the food turned into a sludgy mess in one corner and piled up.also hot spot one side. Returned this product not worth the money. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L Lampe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Deep Fryer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Deep Fryer. Just the right size for doing enough chicken wings for a big feed for two to three people. I like how easy it is to clean. Because you can put parts in the dishwasher the deep fryer always looks like it is brand new. Also, I love that this deep fryer filters the cooking oil and safely stores it below in the storage tray. I would say that this must be the best deep fryer ever built because the quality is SO good and I can not think of a feature that it is missing or could be added. It is a know brainer purchase for those on a Banting, Dr. Atkins or Ketogenic diet. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: NiceGuy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted so much to love this unit, but unfortunately I just don’t. The basket sits too shallowly in the oil so you’re left with not really deep frying at all. You have to stand there and turn the pieces over and over to get them evenly fried. I’m not talking about anything exotic, just drumsticks and chicken wings.Maybe it will work better if I don’t use the basket but, again, what’s the point. I can fry like that in my Dutch oven without spending over $100 to do it. I’m going to give it one more try with fish and chips but if that does work this unit is getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Gal

customer_reviews.title: It is pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it had the odor control feature. It takes a little bit, about 15 minutes to get to temperature (375). It cooks everything as it should. You have to be careful when lowering food in, as the oil can overflow, it has on me. The odor control feature is not as good as I had hoped, but better than many other fryers out there. Depending on what you are cooking, and if the oil is new or not, you can get different degrees of odor. I am still happy with the purchase and would suggest others to buy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Waldby

customer_reviews.title: A let down
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December 2016 and threw it away in May 2017. Initially, I thought this fryer was awesome because I didn't have to worry about controlling the temperature or the splatter and clean up was easy (compared to pan etc). The oil drain tray didn't work well for me. Oil never leaked down or out while cooking. However, the seal did allow air to enter up on more than one occasion while I was frying. It would start to aggressively roil up. The last time it exploded oil it went in the trash (thankfully the lid was on but hot oil ended up all over my counter).
customer_reviews.author: senninmd

customer_reviews.title: Great advertising but a little difference 🤔
customer_reviews.text: Look great on advertising but when I frying not odorless, humidity and smoking around because exhaust fan not working 😡
customer_reviews.author: Pyae

customer_reviews.title: Better Than an Air Fryer!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why the negative reviews were written because this didn't leak for me. If you follow the advice of another customer to make sure that the cap is removed from the oil storage, it won't leak when you transfer the oil to the plastic storage below the fryer. My fryer heated up quickly and maintained the temperature very well. It was easy to clean and I was happy about that. I was surprised that the basket was easy to clean. All in all this was a good purchase for me. I also have an air fryer that I use but if you want a great taste of fried chicken, then this is the one I prefer to use.
customer_reviews.author: William of Florida

customer_reviews.title: I made a batch of frozen french fries and they came out perfect. In the past when I have made them ...
customer_reviews.text: I received this today and could not wait to try it out. I made a batch of frozen french fries and they came out perfect. In the past when I have made them in the oven they require turning halfway though the cooking time and turn out either soggy or hard and dried out. With the T-Fal air fryer all I had to do was poor the fries in close the lid and set the timer, 30 mins later really great french fries.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Silsby

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt get hot enough.
customer_reviews.text: Got this item unboxed washed, assembled, halfway on the oil mark. Plugged it in and away we go. Cranked it up to the highest temp and waited for the light to go out. After about 10min, it was ready to go. Then I tested the temp of the oil with a digital therm.. 355deg. Boo. Wanted to love this fryer, but the one thing you need is heat. This one doesnt get up to advertised temperature resulting in longer frying times and oily food. It seems to be a reoccurring issue as well. I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: THeGAME

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic upgrade over my older deep fryer
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this to replace an older deep fryer and wow is this thing an improvement. At a glance the designs are all very similar but the integrated drain and filtering system makes this a huge upgrade in terms of cleanup and workflow. I've done several cycles with it now and it really makes life easier. Temperature control is good, with only a slight undershoot vs the thermometer I tested with that could easily be within the error margin of the thermometer. If I was going to change anything, I'd raise the max fill line and the reservoir capacity slightly as a few larger chicken drumsticks had to be turned to ensure they were completely cooked.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Soooo Ticked Off Right Now...
customer_reviews.text: I had a friend over for shrimp and clam strips. I was telling them how awesome this fryer is with having a filtering system (they were trying to convince me to use an Air Fryer.) I went to pore filtered oil (3rd time doing so with no problem.....or so I thought) into the container with the heating element, and the plastic that holds the filtered oil separated, spilling half the oil all over the countertop and down the sides. Even though we got a laugh out of my typical bad luck, this evening's dinner was seriously delayed....we ordered out. T-FAL! What's up with this MAJOR design flaw???!!! Did anyone test this product first before throwing it onto the market?!
customer_reviews.author: CookieCrook

customer_reviews.title: I've had NO problems with this fryer. Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of the Air Fryers. Sure they are not as unhealthy for us, but whenever I would use it, I was never really impressed. It was somewhat like deep fried. But it just wasn't. So I looked around Amazon and did some research. I decided on this model. It was delivered two days later and I have loved it from day one. It's super easy to clean. Everything but the heating element and the stand can go in the dishwasher! I've made all sorts of things in it and have probably used it 25 times. Never once have I had an issue and it has held up very well. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dan-O

customer_reviews.title: Not a crispy experience
customer_reviews.text: the frozen food is surely cooked after a half hour of waiting. But, crispy.. NOT... We tried for a couple of months to get the breaded frozen wings to get crisp. then went out and purchased a bottom of the line Cooks with adjustable temp range, and the first time using it with the same product.. It was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside and it took about 25 minutes in all. The T fal doesn't get hot enough in the end stages to get the food crisp. If you don't want crispy, this is nice unit for just cooking thru and thru.. But, crispy,,, adjustable temperatures is what you want.
customer_reviews.author: R., Keene

customer_reviews.title: Great fryer
customer_reviews.text: Great fryer easy to clean/drain oil, cooks great does as good a job as professional cookers. cooked chicken an breaded shrimp to perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Jack V. Tolman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect home fryer for those who miss cooking in a proper food service deep fryer
customer_reviews.text: Zero leaks, beautifully simple controls: a power switch and thermostat, sufficient depth, strong enough to keep the temp up with a significant food drop. A note about depth: it may seem shallow and there are reviews that state that but you have to remember that the food you add displaces the oil and makes the level rise, so dropping a taco shell won't work out well but a full sized chicken breast or basket of fries, tots, Brussels sprouts, etc will have plenty of depth.
customer_reviews.author: Doobfucious

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work Out The Box
customer_reviews.text: The heating element didn't turn on. Not sure what happen, there don't appear to be any signs of damage. I tried resetting the heating element from the back, but nada. I've used this technology before so I am familiar that the magnetic prongs have to be oriented correctly to get power to the heating element. I am a reasonable person so I am going to assume it's an isolated incident. Never the less, you can't get more than one star if it doesn't work, regardless of the reason. I will try to return it, but first got to pour all of the new cooking oil into something first without making a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Disappointed Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product just a bit small.
customer_reviews.text: Taking one star off because of the depth size, however this product does make my life easier. Edit: taking another 2 star off... Used it a few times the plastic cover for oil is made by an idot. It's not even leak proof. Do not even fill close to the max line... Even on it when you go to filter it will start to leak. The mess was a nightmare. I was caught off guard. Also when you go to drain the oil hold both side close to the drain port.... Freaking thing is also loose. The whole top will pop open...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a good unit, but needs some improvement.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't give it 5 stars because it's too shallow. When I fill it to max oil line even drumsticks don't completely submerge and you have to keep turning them. Defeats the purpose of deep fat frying. Also, I don't think the thermo-sensors are accurate. When I set it to 350 to fry chicken, the coating is burnt before the meat is cooked. I've learned to set it to 350, drop the chicken, then cut the heat to lowest setting. I do like the drain system. Makes cleanup and oil reuse convenient, although be careful when pouring the oil back in to frying pan as the lid can come loose and oil goes everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: tomb523Top Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: The first time I tried to fry large grouper, it worked well. The temperature control is also very precise, and the fish is not too burnt. The only problem is that because the container is very large, the deep-fried ingredients need to be deep-fried, so you need to pour oil with the max value of the wok, so that the oiler can't hold so much oil.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie_Du

customer_reviews.title: Complete Disaster
customer_reviews.text: 1. Basket is so small that ONE large potato cut into fries did not fit.... fries over flowed into the oil. 2. Following their directions, I lowered the basket with the top closed and oil came boiling out all over the machine/counter/floor, etc. 3. On/Off light and "Ready" light are impossible to see if they are on in bright light. 4. You can get a free TFAL fryer in my trash can but must come before trash is picked up on Tuesday morning. Used only once.
customer_reviews.author: David M Stout

customer_reviews.title: A MUST Have Kitchen Appliance
customer_reviews.text: Simply awesome 🙂 My husband and I are gluten free and this appliance has made our life so much easier. The pic is of cooked raw chicken that was coated in egg, then arrowroot flour. It cooked it perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: ELIZABETH P PACHNIK

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: Purchased October 2016 Rarely use this machine. Works very well. The timer button has stopped working. But easy just to set a timer or check on it periodically. I don’t think that’s a big deal to be honest. The opening buttons stick. So to have the lid flip open you really have to push or push repeatedly. Not the best design for opening the lid. Overall - the food turns out perfect! Very easy to clean (toss all the removable parts in the dishwasher). Functionality of timer and opener leaves something to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: kg

customer_reviews.title: Superb deep fryer...you won't be dissatisfied...!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well-packaged, heats up very quickly, easy to assemble. We deep fried some sliced and battered yellow summer squash and they came out great. I also feel that this fryer could easily be used in an apartment or smaller kitchen, as it did NOT smoke up our kitchen and caused virtually no additional heat. Tomorrow comes the deep fried chicken strips, shrimp, onion rings, and mushrooms. I had tried several other deep fryers and this one is CLEARLY the best and I recommend it 100%.
customer_reviews.author: JustAGuyInUtah

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is fabulous! Whoever designed the filtration and oil storage is obviously a cook! Deep fat frying is perfect, but all deep fat fryers are pretty good in that regard. It's the oil drain (and strain) into the lower receptacle that is the real genius PLUS the fact that the whole machine comes apart for super easy clean up! Everything except the control go into the dishwasher - if that's what you want to do. Quite frankly, it's so easily cleaned, it's quicker and easier for me to wash in the sink. In my 75 years I've had a lot of small appliances. This is the best of the best! HIGHLY recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ann B. Williams

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: No teflon. Perfect temperature control. Oil filtration system is money saving. I never considered fried green tomatoes or fried chicken due to cost of oil waste. I no longer pay $$ for easy meals for family. A few minutes, and you have a great restaurant fried meal without spending a ton. I know fried food is not good for diet, but damn sometimes you need a treat!
customer_reviews.author: Deanna M.

customer_reviews.title: Heating element stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: This is an over all good machine to fry my fish in. Cleaning and the storage of the oil is easy and a wonderful feature. Unfortunately under a year of moderate use the entire heating element and control unit stopped working. There is a sticker on it that tells you to reset button if it stopped working, but that didn’t work either. Now I have to pay to ship it to one of their authorized repair centers (only 3 within 50 miles of my location) to see if they can repair it. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Cfury38

customer_reviews.title: Love this but read care instructions carefully
customer_reviews.text: I love the fryer but had to rate "Easy to clean" only 3 stars because it came with an additional warning, SEPARATE and CONTRARY from the manual, that states despite what's been advertised, the cover should not be placed in the dishwasher. Also, after running the plastic oil storage container through the dishwasher, it was still heavily coated with oil so I had to wash it vigorously by hand with lots of soap and hot water to clear it all away. We don't plan to use it often but just know when you do, clean up will not be as easy as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: TeeTee537

customer_reviews.title: Only good as a regular deep fryer
customer_reviews.text: As a regular deep fryer, it works great! However, the patented oil filtration and easy to clean is horrible. The first and only time I tried to use the oil filtration, it clogged and there is now a way to remove the mesh net that catches debris. In addition to that, ever since I tried to use the oil filtration, now the deep fryer leaks oil, not in the bottom catch basket, but all over my counter! I wouldn't buy again. Looking on the web site for warranty information, it doesn't have a specific time, just a link to contact for more info.
customer_reviews.author: jlee

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Quality?
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, the plastic trim on the side is broken. The trim is less than 2mm thin. While this should not affect the functionality of the fryer, I'm bummed that I either have to pack/ship it back and wait for the replacement, or suck it up with this flaw. For longer term, I'm more concerned about the quality and durability of this fryer, but I really like the auto oil filtration feature that most fryers on the market do not offer.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Really like it!
customer_reviews.text: So we finally upgraded to this system after having an older Tfal for years. The two selling points for us was the oil drain/store system and ease of cleaning. The drain system lived up to our hopes and is super convenient. Cleaning is easy on the although I had to ding one star on that because it comes in with a big label saying "even though the description says the lid is dishwasher safe, it is hand wash only" which was the only disappointing part. Otherwise, it holds temp well and is super easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest Shopper

customer_reviews.title: This product is a steal!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, just wish it was even bigger. The oil filtration is amazing! You have to wait for the oil to totally cool down before you can release it into the plastic storage container underneath. The temperature stays steady during cooking, and its soo easy to use. I highly recommend this product, you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Paula M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fryer design
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This fryer is great. It heats quickly. The basket handle locks securely into place providing safe use and convenience for storage. The heating element unit, fryer pan,basket and lid are easy to clean. I hand wash them, though instructions state all can be washed in dishwasher except the lid. The biggest advantage of this over other fryers is the ability to filter the oil automatically. The filter process is very effective. This has made frying and cleanup a breeze as well as oil storage between uses. Well done T-fal!
customer_reviews.author: Dogmom54

customer_reviews.title: This products failed!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product base on reviews but overlook a certain review on temperature dropping down when you put food items (such as plantain, fries, etc) and its inability to reach the specified temperature through the frying period. My fries will not get hard but soft since the temperature drops unlike when i use gas with fry pan to prepare it - Now, I am considering buying another deep frier
customer_reviews.author: Festus

customer_reviews.title: Leaks all over the place
customer_reviews.text: This thing is crap. I tried two of them and they both leaked oil. They leaked so much that I’m still cleaning oil from the counters, floors, and cabinets. I thought the first was just defective so I did a return and got a second. It leaked all over as well. I did not exceed the capacity. Just leaked. When it wasn’t leaking the oil was too shallow. Really dumb design. I’m surprised Tfal wouldn’t make this thing a bit smaller in dimension so the oil reservoir was deeper.
customer_reviews.author: JSquaredZ

customer_reviews.title: returned it
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely not worth $140. After using it i might have paid $60 for it. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Reuven

customer_reviews.title: Stable temperature and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: First, I was impressed with the build quality. This is not a cheaply made deep fryer. It is not overly heavy, but is very sturdy and components feel as if they will last many years. Second, the clean up is easy and quick. The deep fryer basin separates from the heating elements to make clean up in a sink very easy. The oil drain option works well and leaves the oil in a container for ease of reuse. Also, the power cord attaches magnetically, which is a nice touch. I thoroughly enjoy using this deep fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick E. Wolf Jr.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY--THIS PRODUCT EXPLODED ON OUR COUNTER
customer_reviews.text: We are experienced cooks and have no problems with deep frying. This product overheats quickly and once food is removed, it is dangerous. Several times, it bubbles and boils up after we unplug it. It exploded on our counter last night, sending oil everywhere, (including the ceiling). We will have to now repaint part of our kitchen. The wood floor is ruined. There is clearly something wrong with the heating element. Avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: jgcgirl

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ, really like how well it strains the oil for future use. WARNING! The edges on all the pressed aluminum parts are poorly if ever deburred! I read another post saying the edges were sharp, understatement! I cut the crap out of my hand washing the cover, I mean CUT! I work with metals as a hobby and deburred the edges with a red scotchbrite pad and a fine hand file. Please be careful until or if you do this. I had prior notice from a review and still cut myself. Five stars otherwise. Works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Something Different
customer_reviews.text: Product works great, but has some issues. This unit includes an on/off switch that most deep friers don’t have included. The “automatic filter” system isn’t automatic at all, uses gravity. This device pours the oil through the filter at just the right time/temperature. Doesn’t seem to work at first, but given enough time/temperature it works real fast. I had to rewrite my review several times to figure this unit out. It’s different and unique from any other deep friers I’ve used in the past. Cooks food fast and even heats up the oil fast. Good product, but takes some getting used too.
customer_reviews.author: JohnK253

customer_reviews.title: Yum
customer_reviews.text: Was sick of baked French fries... sooooo much better deep fried! Chicken, fish, tennis shoes...they all taste better now 😁
customer_reviews.author: Spidey

customer_reviews.title: There is now a gallon of oil in my carpet.
customer_reviews.text: Frying food is fine, the debacle is using the see through plastic canister to store the oil. Now maybe directions would have told differently but the fact is when going to carry the oil to the refrigerator the canister pops open unexpectedly like a Tupperware bowl. It has one handle as if you would carry it sideways taking it anywhere away from the fryer. one gallon instantly down my leg on my shoe's and into the rug. Imagine if that had been hot oil! Thanks T-Fal.
customer_reviews.author: xchrisp

customer_reviews.title: Fry's really well !!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this fryer but to compare to the others I have had I would say what I didn't like about this product is when pour the oil back in the fryer it does sipe from the side of the plastic container which others have also said. Not a deal breaker just annoying That's why I gave it a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: Tommie Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fryer on 8/17/17. First I noticed there were several times it didn’t seem to reach the proper temp, resulting in food undercooked and soggy with oil. About a week ago I pulled it apart and cleaned the basket, tray and lid. When I put it back together, it now doesn’t power on at all! I’ve tried everything, but nothing. Of course I paid $80 for a fryer that died right after the one year warranty expired! I’ve had cheap fry daddy’s that have lasted way longer than this fryer. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Roosevelt J.

customer_reviews.title: fryer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this fryer! It is sizeable, but I wanted to be able to put more than 1 chicken strip in it at a time so that works for me. Very easy to drain and clean - most of the parts pop into the dishwasher. Really like the oil filtration to keep my oil cleaner longer - that's easy to use as well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: F. Gast

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fryer. The cord was too short and it was pretty big, so hard to find a spot for it. As for the functions of it, it worked out great. Easy to use, the lid/shield was very nice with no splattering, ventilation system worked great with no smelly oil odor, and the basket bar is a great idea and makes it safe to use. Everthing we cooked was yummy. The only problem i really had was the cord was too short.
customer_reviews.author: rosanna fraker

customer_reviews.title: Great Fryer but Shoddy Customer Relations
customer_reviews.text: Size: 4 stars Operation; 5 stars Customer Service: 2 stars This is the second T-fal fryer I have purchased. I bought the FR7000 in 2014. It lasted just over a year. This model has only lasted about four months with 2 - 3 times per week usage. Although it is under warranty, T-fal requires the customer to pay for shipping to and from one of its service centers for repair which is about $70 round trip. I can buy a new for just over $100. I'm am purchasing another one because it is a great fryer, easy to clean, and saves on oil. However, if this one fails, I'll never buy a product from T-fal again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Soderling

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the whinney pricks below! This fryer rocks!
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks! Have used for almost two years. You will actually use this fryer. The oil filtration is what makes it stand out. Looks as good after frying as the new oil. Temp is accurate. No complaints at all except I wish they made a bigger size for when I have a lot of people to cook for.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. B

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product cheap service.
customer_reviews.text: The gears broke within 3 months of light use. The assurion 4 year warranty told me to deal with the manufacturer. I haven't been able to reach Tfal. Save your money on both the fryer and assurion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deep fryer
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money if its a replacement or purchasing new. It is important to know not to fill past that max line because if you do, it will overflow in the filtration, unless you are keeping any eye on it. Be mindful that it can use almost 5 quarts of oil just to fill it up. But you could easily get 10 uses out of the oil after filtering dependent upon what you're cooking. Which is way better than throwing it out. I definitely have gotten my money out of this deep fryer. We didn't eat a lot of fried foods. But I love it for french fries and such.
customer_reviews.author: Latrice Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am basically pretty happy with this I would not say it is odorless it does have a fan and a cheaper filter but you can still smell what is cooking very easily but all in all it would say that it is worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a lot of fryers over the years and this one is by far the best that I've purchased. Granted, it's the most expensive one I've purchased but I can't say enough good things about it. I use mine outdoors to keep the smells out of the house so I can't speak to anything odor related. As others have noted, it feels a little shallow at first glance but once you start using it that seems to go away. It can handle 14 wings at a time easily and probably more than that. It bounces right back to temp in an impressive time as well.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas M Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Filtering and Draining makes cleanup a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: Best Deep Dryer I've ever owned, period. Bought this specifically for the draining capability, which allows me to filter & drain the oil into the built-in pan, then put the pan in the refrigerator. Have now been using this deep fryer for almost a year, and I've never had to "change" the oil - I just have to top it off every now and then. Throw the rest of the parts (except the immersion unit, of course) into the dishwasher, and everything comes out looking brand new. No black crud buildup like all my other deep fryers. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who likes deep fried food, but doesn't like the cleanup of conventional deep fryers.
customer_reviews.author: Southern

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Fryer
customer_reviews.text: My first at-home deep fryer, and I love it. Keeps the oil at the perfect temperature, so the grease doesn't splatter everywhere when I cook something. The oil filtration & storage container work flawlessly, no leaks. Everything comes apart easily to be cleaned, or just put in the dishwasher. The only problem I have is that I like to hand-wash the items, which is pretty labor-intensive. Therefore, it sometimes keeps me from getting it out to make the food I really want since I know I'll have 10 minutes of cleaning afterward. BUT, if you're good with putting the parts in the dishwasher, it's a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Levan Cuthbert

customer_reviews.title: Still love it after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Love the built in filter. It makes cleaning much easier and extends the usable life of the oil. just drain it, clean the fryer, and replace the filtered oil and you are good to go again. Heats much faster than my older fryer this one replaced. The lid also has a better vent which has made it safer to use the lid when frying foods with higher water content. It certainly helps to keep the surrounding areas much more clean. I just wish it came with two baskets instead of the one large basket. But I knew that when I bought it, so I can't take away a star for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Ooohhh SOooo GOood!!!
customer_reviews.text: Took a little time to get use to it. Still working on this, though! I don't cook large quantities, maybe 1/3 the amount in most recipes. I've had to learn proper cooking times for these quantities. Fresh sweet potatoes are difficult for me, up to now. I've found that coating the fresh potatoes with very light covering of cooking spray helps in cooking, and keeps the potatoes from sticking together. Fry style seem to cook better then chip style. I have found that frozen fries are easier to cook than fresh, but I am making progress in this area. Clean-up is easy. This product disassembles easily, and assembles quickly. This is an "outstanding" product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Pappa Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great for Frying Fries and Fish
customer_reviews.text: I really like this fryer. Initially I expected that it was deeper but the oil pan takes up a good amount of space. Overall I'm very happy. It allows me to filter and store the oil between uses. The basket works really well. I've used it to make homemade french fries and store bought french fries. I've also used it to make battered fish. I made the decision to not filter any oil that I've used to make fish. Instead I simply try and time it so that I make the fish towards the end of the oils life and dump out the used oil after making fish. It works great at my house!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Oliveri

customer_reviews.title: The best deep fryer ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and did my research - anyone who gave this product a bad review doesn’t know how to use a deep fryer. It was simple, didn’t take a lot of oil and my tempura shrimp was done to perfection. The fryer was very easy to clean and the oil saver was fabulous. We had to wait for it because it was back ordered but well worth the wait. Give your family a treat and some delicious deep fried treats - you won’t be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: RS Foster

customer_reviews.title: Feel like it has to go back to the seller
customer_reviews.text: Works, but have doubts about the construction, the main reason is that the top does not completely close, letting the heat to go through the cracks. Takes long time to prepare food. Timer only makes noise, does not shut off the motor, which is totally ridiculous. Feel like it has to go back to the seller.
customer_reviews.author: BriK

customer_reviews.title: only heats oil to 250 F
customer_reviews.text: I tried 2 of these cookers, neither worked as advertised, I just contacted t fal, they say i can ship it back at my expense. This thing only heats up to 250 degrees F. The 2 that i tried were junk.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Best Deep Fryer in the market!!!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the best deep fryer in the market. It is very easy to use and clean. The temperature control is very easy. It is big enough to fry. The besting function is oil filtration after use. Just simply turn it to "Oil Filtration" and wait until used oil goes to the storage for later usage. And, clean it and reuse it. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch & Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very,very nice. What ever problems might have cropped up before have been expertly fixed now. All the reviews on YouTube gave glowing reports except one, which kinda had me concerned, but now that I've had & used this T-fal, Ultimate EZ Clean deep fryer, and it works perfectly well, I'm totally loving it. It is very well & smartly constructed so I'm fairly confident it will perform great for some time. Includes warranty .
customer_reviews.author: WP

customer_reviews.title: cleans up pretty easily, the filtration works surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: It controls temperature quickly and accurately, cleans up pretty easily, the filtration works surprisingly well. However, for it's size, the oil is confoundingly shallow; perhaps an inch deep at max. No chicken legs or bone-in breasts, a hush puppy would have to be flat or tiny, and so on. The metal parts are quite a thin gauge, I haven't damaged anything so far, but I'm not confident that will last. The cover should be hinged, it's an annoyance having to find a place to rest it while you tend your meal. It would be nice if the heating element could be removed from the control unit for cleaning. It's tremendous at fries and chips, but be aware of its limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Ermghoti

customer_reviews.title: The heating element died within 1st 4 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I loved it - until it died. I just sent it back to Amazon. I have started researching fryers again. I am tempted to order another just like - hoping the heating element failure was just a fluke. I had it for 3 1/2 weeks. I used it 2-3 times a week. I understand T-Fal doesn't have replacement parts. If I ordered it again, and it fails, I'm concerned about how long it will take to get it fixed. The way it is designed to drain & filter the oil, is great. A definite selling point.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Tubandt

customer_reviews.title: Best one I found.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, uses a lot of oil, I think the temp runs a little On the hot side. Only real con is the magnetic cord. I know it’s a safety thing but very short and falls off easily. Tried three other ones and they were worse. Seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: lookin for comfort

customer_reviews.title: T-Fal EZ Clean
customer_reviews.text: Frying anything means work but this unit presents a very nice fried chicken dinner. Cleanup is pretty easy and the drain system is absolutely great. A fairly large unit so check your space availability.Unfortunately there is only a small guide (we went on line to print a larger copy). A few questions are also available on their website. It would have been nice if a photo guide for the use of this fryer would have been supplied. The UPC on the box did not match the one on the registration card and the on-line registration address did not work (mailed it in). Well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate
customer_reviews.text: The people who are giving this fryer one star reviews, minus the people with initial product defects, just simply don't know what they're talking about. This fryer will make you the hero of not only your household, but your entire neighborhood. It heats up and cooks extremely fast, especially for a 100$ model. My family has gained probably 30 pounds collectively since getting this fryer, but that's just a testament to the quality it produces. A+
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best Fryer Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good about this fryer. Love the oil filtration system. Is super easy to clean and keep clean. More compact size than my last fryer and takes far less oil to fill (= cost savings). Love the see through lid. I've done fish, wings, hushpuppies - everything cooks to perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Barbara Kight

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive Advertising
customer_reviews.text: The product is advertised as easy to clean, all parts dishwasher safe. This is not true. There is a flyer that comes with the unit that says "Contrary to what is written in the instructions or in the packaging, the lid cannot be cleaned in the dishwasher due to the aggressive nature of the cleaning agents on the market. Only hand washing is allowed." The main reason I purchased this unit is they claim the parts are dishwasher safe. Very deceptive advertising.
customer_reviews.author: soapman

customer_reviews.title: Great deep fryer for home use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a bit on impulse but I love it. I make fried plantains, chicken, shrimp, vegetables, apple fritters, chicken wings, sweet potatoe fries, corn chips, and especially amazing french fries. Having the built-in oil storage is really great. I've used both peanut and canola oil with great results. The filtration system works well for most of the material but I also bought some paper filters that remove particles down to 0.5 micron and use them sometimes when I've cooked something especially messy. This has teh best overall design of any small fryer that I've seen on the market.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Barely get over 300 degrees.
customer_reviews.text: According to my Thermapen Mk4 by Thermaworks, oil gets to only 312 degrees. Not nearly hot enough to fry foods without getting sogged out in oil. Sending this thing back for a refunds since there are too many other reviews indicating the issue with oil getting hot enough to properly fry.
customer_reviews.author: V. Laney

customer_reviews.title: Very great but take lots of oil.
customer_reviews.text: Love the self draining and filter. Awesome. I can reuse it sevarl times now depending on what foods I choose to use. I have fried chicken, french fries spuds, bacon wrapped fried chicken. All of it came out golden, perfect and amazing each time of course I use a meat thermometer as well but the duo are great for cooking would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Johnni

customer_reviews.title: Easiest to clean fryer I have found
customer_reviews.text: I hated cleaning and scrubbing old stuck on oil and food grime out of oil fryers so I got an air fryer. It fried some things fine, but other things not good at all and didn't work well. I decided to go back to oil with this one. It fries really well, cleans up well, and you can reuse filtered oil multiple times. I really like it. When you're done cooking, flip the switch. It will drain when cool enough. Then wipe out the leftover food bits and refill with the oil when you want to use it again. Wash out with soap and water as needed. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: Mom to three

customer_reviews.title: filtration did not work
customer_reviews.text: We used the deep fryer last night, and it cooked great. we turned everything off and turned the handle to the filtration choice, we woke up this morning and the oil is till on the deep frying part and did not filtrate. we are going to heat up the fryer again to see if maybe it was just hicup this first time. if it does not work again we will be returning it to amazon. I will make an update later tonight to see if it worked the second time around.
customer_reviews.author: steven m.

customer_reviews.title: DOA didn't work, expected better construction.
customer_reviews.text: I suppose I could have paired more attention to the reviews. Mine showed up DOA,(dead on arrival). What A disappointment. I also purchased the protection plan. So I had to file two separate refund requests. Additionally the construction of the fryer itself was pretty flimsy. I expected more from T-fal. ( I seem to remember better things from them, but who knows....) Even though it was brand new, I did not expect to see the unit leaking. The clean up was a mess. I'm so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso N. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and very useful
customer_reviews.text: Very practical, kind of big to handle around, but very practical on the actual use.The filtration and storage unit is fantastic.It saves time and messy handling of the oil after use.Easy to storage, well constructed.The main reservoir is of stainless steel, very convenient for the manipulating of oil, easy to clean, just put the parts in the dishwasher(not the electric elements of course, follow the instructions as per mfg.)The controls are not very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro J. Baptista

customer_reviews.title: Fry Night Saturday
customer_reviews.text: The easiest most convenient frier ever. We have Pizza Friday and now Fry Night Saturday. I’ve stored the oil in the base and then stored the fryer in the wine cellar to keep it fresh. I wash all the appropriate parts in the dishwasher and hand wash the other part in very hot soapy water, easy. 20 minute clean up. The temperature rises quickly so we have very little oil absorption. Bread patties, taters, chicken, pepper poppers, shrimp, fish, Brussels spouts and cauliflower are our favorites. So easy to get out, use, clean and store.
customer_reviews.author: Shiraz

customer_reviews.title: Good fryer, but still not hot enough.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, it just needs to get 25 degrees hotter. Only heats to 374, and though I haven't measured it, it seems like it's not even getting that hot. Did ok with fries and tatertots but struggles with donuts because it can't get hot enough. The auto filter feature is frankly AWESOME but I would really like to see the bottom pan be made of stainless steel not plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second One We've Purchased for Our Family!! It's fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this deep fryer several years ago for our younger son. He thinks it's awesome. The self-draining/storing function is wonderful. Over Thanksgiving, he used it when our older son was visiting and that son was also impressed. Thus, we purchased one for him as a Christmas gift. It's well-made, functional, durable, easy to use, and works great!! We highly recommend the T-fal deep fryer with oil filtration.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Mabry

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but messy cleanup.
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with thermostat: it would shut off when reaching selected temp, but would not come back on until the oil had cooled too much to cook. I returned it, It is called EZ Clean, however, It found it very difficult to clean, The parts go into the dishwasher, so it cleans well, but the heating element had to be hand washed and my kitchen was a mess including the floor. My old method of deep frying was a deep kettle will wire basket that I put on the range. Not nearly as messy.
customer_reviews.author: Aspenmeadow

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We love this deep fryer! The oil is filtered into a plastic container and then you can reuse again with ease. So much better than cooking in a cast iron skillet because the oil stays at the temperature you set. We had fush and chips to perfection and the next night fried shrimp and onion rings. We can't wait to try fried chicken!
customer_reviews.author: William M

customer_reviews.title: Great countertop fryer
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had this too long but so far it’s been fantastic. I’ve made chicken, meatballs, coconut shrimp and lumpia and they all came out perfectly done. Clean up is super easy and the filter/drain/store feature works as advertised. The cover can be used while cooking which keeps the area around the fryer very clean but isn’t so tight that it keeps in the steam. Like with any frying method just don’t crowd the food and you should get perfect results.
customer_reviews.author: Ole Whiskers

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I took a couple months to do this review because I need to try this really well. And the conclusion is this, it's the best deep oil ever made. I tell why, the proprietary drain filtration oil system from t_fal, u can use the oil more times without any mess and smell. It is very well made (profissional grade).
customer_reviews.author: F.Iablonski

customer_reviews.title: WARNING:  Please Read before Use: Caution:
customer_reviews.text: Love the fryer. Works well heats up and stays hot. Easy to clean. Bigger than I thought but thats OK. Be careful when filling fryer with oil. The Max fill line is inside on the right side and is hard to see. If you fill 1 drop over the max line it will over flow the pan when draining. I must have filled a bit over the Max line and the oil drained all over counter and ran in floor. Clean up was way over 1 hour. Would have given 5 stars if max fill line had been easier to see . Pan used for catching clean oil could have been a bit bigger to prevent accidents.
customer_reviews.author: gracie gray

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one use
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I found the idea of frying in the house somewhat scary, so I waited a while to use it. Like over a year. However, just used it about a month ago and it worked. Got excited and planned a whole Superbowl menu around frying chicken drumsticks in it. However, this time plugged it in and nothing. Broken. Tried to get it to heat up or even show the little light on many times since and it just will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Best deep fryer on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This fryer is AMAZING! Initially, I perceived the frying area to be a bit small, boy was I wrong! It heats very quickly and cooks a good amount (this far, we have prepared egg rolls, wontons, canolli shells, chicken tenders, and fries...all cooked to perfection). The cook was even and exceeded expectations. The major bonus was the oil filtration and easy clean up. I can't gish enough over the clean oil storage! Would highly revommend this fryer to occasional and heavy users both.
customer_reviews.author: JediMom

customer_reviews.title: It does not leak!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that the oil catchment feature wouldn't work properly since this brand has had that issue with a different model. Whatever the case, this model does not leak and the oil drain and catchment is great. It filters and recaptures oil so you're not using a strainer and funnel to avoid wasting oil. It gets to temp quickly and fries food as you'd expect. Nothing fancy but it does the job and is easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: M. R.

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed. I had hoped to be able to use ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed. I had hoped to be able to use batter and or coating on vegetables and the wheel in the middle stacks the items up and wipes the coating off. Now I have, unfortunately, missed the window of return.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Beware: I brought this twice; one lasted a year and the second one lasted 6 months; Never Again!!!
customer_reviews.text: Beware: I brought this twice; one lasted a year and the second one lasted 6 months; Never Again!!! I purchased in September 2018 then in September 2019 it stopped working (wouldn't turn on) I purchased a second one in October 2019 and now is stopped working too, wouldn't turn on I can never recommend anyone to purchase this product nor can never see myself buying TFal again. I did not contact TFAl yet (and I will) but I pretty sure I am just out the money, twice now....
customer_reviews.author: William Kocak

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and we love it!! We have cooked everything from fried chicken, wings, vegetable tempura, French fries~both Idaho and sweet potato! We only used it on our counter once, we now have it sitting on our grill outside. I can’t stand the smell of frying foods...but I love to eat it.
customer_reviews.author: SLF

customer_reviews.title: Definitely something I use on a regular basis..
customer_reviews.text: Having owned it about a month, and bought a couple of additional cookbooks for it, I'm still kind of amazed at how well and easy it is to cook in this beast. I wish I could successfully cook two things in it at the same time, or that it were a little faster, but hey, dump in 6 chicken nuggets and a handful of frozen fries. Punch 35 minutes, and voila! Lunch without all the oil... Chicken wings work great too, as does making Chicken Tikka Masala (or any chicken recipe I've tried so far really)... I've recommended it to most of my friends at work..
customer_reviews.author: W. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Product is great but customer service is non-existant
customer_reviews.text: I love the fryer and it seems to work as advertised but I called customer service on a missing item and was basically told I had to jump through a bunch of hoops to get them to help me. In frustration I gave up on them and had Amazon fix the issue. I won't buy anything from T-fal again because of their lack of customer support.
customer_reviews.author: DC

product_meta.title: T-fal Deep Fryer with Basket, Stainless Steel, Easy to Clean Deep Fryer, Oil Filtration, 2.6-Pound, Silver, Model FR8000
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Easy Clean Deep Fryer

T fal Deep Fryer with Basket, Stainless Steel, Easy to Clean Deep Fryer, Oil Filtration, 2.6 Pound, Silver, Model FR8000. Make restaurant quality fried food at home—minus the hassle and mess—thanks to the Ultimate EZ Clean deep fryer by T fal. Designed for family size dinners or hors d'oeuvres when entertaining, the deep fryer offers a 3.5 liter oil capacity and a 2.65 pound fresh food capacity. Appetizers, main courses, or desserts—make the classics or let your creative inspirations soar. The powerful 1700 watt fryer’s adjustable thermostat allows for selecting the perfect cooking temperature for the specific food to be fried, while its quick recovery heating system ensures crispy layers with minimal oil absorption for healthier results. When finished, the innovative machine’s exclusive oil filtration system automatically drains and filters the remaining oil into a large plastic container below.For best results we recommend unsaturated vegetable oil. The removable, tightly sealed container conveniently stores the oil for future use, saving time and money. Other highlights include a two position basket for cooking and draining food, a viewing window in the lid, cool touch handles, a permanent odor filter to keep cooking odors out of the kitchen, and dishwasher safe parts for quick cleanup. With the T fal Ultimate EZ Clean deep fryer, frying delicious food at home just got a whole lot easier.
feature_bullets: POWERFUL PERFORMANCE: Powerful 1700 watt deep fryer with 3.5 liter oil capacity and 2.65 pound food capacity to offer friends and family all their favorite fried food
EASY TO USE: With 2 position basket for cooking and draining food; Handles for easy transportation and storage
PATENTED OIL FILTRATION SYSTEM: EZ Clean oil filtration system for convenient deep frying, cost savings, and simple oil storage
PROFESSIONAL RESULTS: Professional and healthier results thanks to the immersed heating element that quickly recovers oil temperature
DISHWASHER SAFE: Easy to clean with dishwasher safe parts

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,136 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
